revised_title: Nephridia of Perichaeta: An Archaic Excretory System
tldr: The author studied the nephridia of Perichaeta, a type of earthworm, and found that their excretory system is more archaic than previously thought. The nephridia form a network of tubules connected between segments, which is similar to the excretory system of some Platyhelminths. This discovery supports the idea that Annelida can be derived from the Platyhelminth excretory system.
